clues.text:
2004:
The super voices of Craig T. Nelson, Holly Hunter & Jason Lee

2018:
Mahershala Ali, Viggo Mortensen & Linda Cardellini drive the film

1989:
Olympia Dukakis, Sally Field & Julia Roberts & a 4th star--the weeping audience

2021:
Simu Liu, Tony Leung & Awkwafina
clues.response: Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings

clues.text:
1988:
Kevin Costner, Susan Sarandon & Robert Wuhl, who makes a memorable visit to the mound
This city is Pennsylvania's only port on the St. Lawrence Seaway
A natural history museum, the Koenig is in this city, once the capital of West Germany
The capital of this landlocked African nation is N'Djamena
This world capital began hosting Holmenkollen ski jump competition in 1892
Emily Blunt & John Krasinski tied the knot at George Clooney's villa on this lake
His mentor Serge Koussevitzky suggested he change his name to Leonard S. Burns; he said no
Once a manuscript copyist for Wagner, Hans Richter conducted the first performance of this full cycle of operas
On an 1887 cruise New York Symphony Society conductor Walter Damrosch met this tycoon & talked him into building a hall
Sir Thomas Beecham conducted many U.K. premieres at the Royal Opera House in this London "Garden" spot
2 female music directors: Marin Alsop at the BSO (Baltimore Symphony) & Joann Falletta at the BPO (this N.Y. city's philharmonic)

rounds.comments: (Mayim: There will be food in each response.)

clues.text: Okies head west
A grandfather tells a story about a town called Chewandswallow where food falls from the sky
Violent gangs of Droogs run wild in the streets of an English city
Play in which a working class African-American family moves into an all-white Chicago neighborhood
Just after World War II, a woman learns of a group of book lovers on one of the Channel Islands
clues.response: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society

clues.text: In spring, head out from this largest Dutch city to the regional trade event focusing on tulips
Toronto's Collision Conference has a program for these tech companies named for their fledgling nature
This Austin-based meet-up was focused on music when it launched in 1987, but now includes other media
In 2018 the India Mobile Congress event focused on telecom issues, especially this new alphanumeric mobile network
Billed as the "most influential tech event in the world", this event featuring gizmos & gadgets has been held in Las Vegas since 1978
A group of newborn animals, or to scatter trash about
A hot dog condiment, or to enjoy
A multitude, or the bread that's consecrated in the Eucharist
A wind-blown pile of snow, or the meaning of what you're saying
Your equal, or to look at closely
Murders abound on the fictional Caribbean island of Saint-Marie, which doesn't seem much like Eden in "Death in" this
Poisoned by snake venom on his uniform in 2003, Commander Ray Trapp was the first of many, many naval personnel killed on this show
Good cops CCH Pounder & Forest Whitaker hounded killer cop Michael Chiklis & the strike team on this FX series
The "Murders" in this British detective show take place in the fictional title county, not the dog days of August
"Better pay attention or this world we love so much might just kill you", Randy Newman sang in this show's opening theme
A Wesleyan residence is named for this African-American leader; a cultural center at Mount Holyoke, for his wife Betty Shabazz
At Stanford, this presidential family has its name on a pavilion, a memorial building, a tower & an institute
A USC cinema building is named for this director who was rejected 3 times by the school & attended Cal State Long Beach instead
In 2021 this S.E.C. school in Alabama renamed Eagle Hall to honor Dr. Josetta Brittain Matthews, its first African-American graduate
The Neil Armstrong Hall of Engineering goes above & beyond at this school in West Lafayette, Indiana
Neil Patrick Harris was Count Olaf on this series; Patrick Warburton played author Lemony Snicket
This native of Dorchester, Massachusetts starred as the titular Boston cop in Netflix' "Spenser Confidential"
"Bastogne" was an episode of this war-set miniseries based on Stephen Ambrose's book
A Hulu miniseries was based on this John Green novel, with Miles Halter in search of the titular Ms. Young
Jennifer Connelly stars in this TV series based on a graphic novel & set aboard a train that perpetually circles a frozen world
Combining hip-hop & street jazz, the Brooklynettes are the dance team for this NBA squad
What we call the "magnetic" this attracts the north magnetic poles of compass needles, so it's actually a south magnetic pole
Hammacher Schlemmer sells a $9,500 gyroscopic one of these swaying items
Man o' War's first defeat came in 1919 at Saratoga in an upset by this horse
The flag that Betsy Ross sewed for the new union of the colonies in 1777 had 13 stars in the top inner corner, the area called this
John Nevison, one of these bandits with a type of road in the name, was hanged in the 1680s at a place fittingly called Knavesmire
A scotch & vermouth drink bears the name of this 18th century highland outlaw
The 1930s outlaw born Arizona Donnie Clark was better known by this motherly married name
In 1880 bushranger Ned Kelly & his gang briefly captured the township of Glenrowan in what's now this country
John died in a shootout & Bob in prison, but Cole, the older of these brothers, lived to star in Wild West shows
A common Italian surname, Rossi comes from a word for this, be it hair color or complexion
Actor Andy & golfer Sergio both have this last name, the most popular surname in Spain
The name Chevrolet goes back to a word for this animal, or perhaps one who kept them
Bill Clinton took his stepfather's last name, but his name at birth was William Jefferson this (the III)
This last name of a land manager in Ireland came to be used for a refusal to do business with a particular company or country

rounds.text: The American Professional Football Association, which became the NFL in 1922, was organized in 1920 in this city
